meanings.definition: To regard or represent as perfect or better than reality.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overidealize her favorite singer, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overidealize celebrities based on their social media posts.
meanings.sent3: Don't overidealize your crush; they're human too and have flaws.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes we overidealize our memories, making them seem better than they actually were.
meanings.sent5: Try not to overidealize situations, as it can lead to disappointment.

meanings.definition: To have an excessively high or unrealistic opinion of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overidealize his boss, thinking he can do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: It's common to overidealize a new relationship in the beginning.
meanings.sent3: She overidealized her new phone, only to find out it had many issues.
meanings.sent4: Don't overidealize success; it takes hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: It's important not to overidealize people, as everyone has their flaws.
